title: Luchazi (1963) Genesis Portion
description: Luchazi (Lucazi, Chiluchazi) is a Bantu language of Angola and Zambia. Luchazi is the principal language of the Ngangela Group. Ngangela is a term coined by the Vimbundu traders and missionaries in 18th century to describe the tribes occupying the area of eastern-central Angola.

language.name: Luchazi
language.area: Southeast, adjacent areas, Moxico Province, Lucazi municipality. Kuando-Kubango: Mavinga until Kuito Kuanavale. Also in Namibia, Zambia.
